item.title: Worldwide Devotional, January 2017
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson talks about prophets, leadership, and divine law during the January 2017 Worldwide Devotional.

item.title: Love and Marriage
item.description: Sister Wendy W. Nelson talks about love and marriage during the January 2017 Worldwide Devotional.

item.title: Prophets, Leadership, and Divine Law
item.description: President Russell M. Nelson talks about prophets, leadership, and divine law during the January 2017 Worldwide Devotional.

item.title: Man's Search for Happiness (1964)
item.description: Answers the questions: Where did we come from? What is the purpose of life? Where do we go after death? Presents birth, life, and death in an eternal perspective. Emphasizes the importance of the family unit in God's plan.

category.title: Teachings of the Presidents of the Church
category.subtitle: Videos: 5

category.title: Teachings of the Presidents of the Church: Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: How Can I Find Happiness?
item.description: Elder Scott explains that as you continue to center your mind and heart in the Lord, He will help you have a rich and full life no matter what happens in the world around you.

item.title: Prayer
item.description: Learn from a humble woman's example how the power of prayer can work miracles in our lives.

item.title: The Family: A Proclamation to the World
A Book of Mormon Story
item.description: A young bishop in England describes how the Book of Mormon came to life for him and changed his perspective forever.

item.title: Succession in the Presidency
item.description: President Hinckley teaches about succession in the Presidency.

item.title: Where Justice, Love, and Mercy Meet
item.description: Two brothers attempt to climb a sheer canyon wall without any safety ropes or harnesses. Read Elder Holland's full conference address: https://www.lds.org/general-conference/2015/04/where-justice-love-and-mercy-meet

item.title: Action Partners: Sam and Dave
item.description: A pair of action partners describes what they did to support one another and how it led them to greater self-reliance.

item.title: Action Partners: Gabby and Beth
item.description: A pair of action partners describes what they did to support one another and how it led them to greater self-reliance.

item.title: Choosing a Self-Reliance Group
item.description: This video introduces members to the various self-reliance groups and helps them select which group they will join. Includes members’ experiences with self-reliance groups.

item.title: The Power of the Group
item.description: A self-reliance group participant describes what makes the group experience so powerful.

item.description: This video demonstrates that working hard should be combined with working smart as a job seeker. Focus on resources and contacts every day.

item.title: Family Councils
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard shares instruction and promises about family councils.

item.title: Widow of Zarephath
item.description: The Lord rewards faith as we strive for self-reliance.

item.title: Digital Systems
item.description: The benefits of using apps, computers, and other digital systems to create and manage a budget.

item.title: The Envelope System
item.description: A simple and popular method for budgeting is presented.

item.title: Hector: Improving More Than Just My Business
item.description: Hector gets the support and knowledge he needs to improve and develop his business by trusting in the Lord and attending a self-reliance group.

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 1: Richard G. Scott
item.description: Introduction by Elder Richard G. Scott

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 2: Russell M. Nelson
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about the Abrahamic Covenant. April 1995 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 3: Jacob de Jager
item.description: Elder Jacob de Jager speaks about loving one another, and seeing each other as children of God. October 1976 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 4-1: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland tells a story about his experience at a Zone Conference. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 20, 2000 Segment 1

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 4-2: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland tells a story about his experience at a Zone Conference. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 20, 2000 Segment 2

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 4-3: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland reveals the two most fundamental things we want investigators to do prior to baptism. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 20, 2000 Segment 3

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 4-4: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland speaks about what a convert's new life is to be built upon. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 20, 2000 Segment 4

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 5: Boyd K. Packer
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer speaks about having a 'delete key' in our mind. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 26, 2002

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 6: Richard G. Scott
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott speaks about people who have sinned and feel they can never really be whole again. October 2000 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 7: Boyd K. Packer
item.description: Elder Boyd K. Packer speaks about people who have sinned and feel they can never really be whole again. April 1989 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 8: Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: Elder Neal A. Maxwell speaks about how the Lord gives us revelation in His own time. April 2001 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 9: A Man Without Eloquence
item.description: A portrayal of President Brigham Young sharing the story of his conversion from A Man without Eloquence

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 10: L. Tom Perry
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry reflects on how his personal study time as a missionary affected his life. October 2001 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 11: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: A model on how to use knowledge of the plan of salvation to deal with problems and questions. The Plan of Salvation

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 12: Russell M. Nelson
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about how the atonement brings comfort for physical death. October 1996 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 13: Merrill J. Bateman
item.description: Elder Merrill J. Bateman speaks about how the priesthood is the power and authority of God delegated to man. October 2003 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 14: Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about the Great Apostasy as well as the Restoration of the Gospel. October 1999 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 15: Russell M. Nelson
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about the time required to translate the Book of Mormon. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 23, 2000

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 16: L. Tom Perry
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry speaks about the organization of the church. October 1994 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 17: Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley compares green wood to an investigator of the church. April 2002 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 20-1: Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks about physical and emotional challenges missionaries may have before serving missions. First Worldwide Leadership Training Meeting, January 11, 2003 Segment 1

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 21: Richard G. Scott
item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott speaks about missionaries taking medication. October 2003 General Conference

item.title: Mission Preparation Track 23: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland explains how the difficulties of missionary work are related to the Atonement. Seminar for New Mission Presidents, June 20, 2000

item.title: An Apostle's Invitation
item.description: Elder Ballard meets with a group of seminary students about their upcoming year of seminary and teaches them about inviting their friends to seminary.

item.title: Man's Search for Happiness (1964)
item.description: Answers the questions: Where did we come from? What is the purpose of life? Where do we go after death? Presents birth, life, and death in an eternal perspective. Emphasizes the importance of the family unit in God's plan.

item.title: He Cared, He Listened
item.description: A Young Men quorum adviser's care and time helped Dane turn his life around and serve a mission.

item.title: Help Others Move toward the Savior
item.description: Humberto's scout master served as a mentor to him through his youth and was a positive influence on his decision to serve a mission and move toward the Savior.

item.title: Just Take Some Time
item.description: When Jeremy's Aaronic Priesthood adviser took the time to get to know him, it changed Jeremy's life.
